title: Fiona Reynolds: Why Climate Risk Matters for Investors
text: The growth of sustainable investing can be attributed, in part, to The Principles for Responsible Investment, a U.N.-backed initiative that asset owners and investment managers have enthusiastically signed. Leading the charge is CEO Fiona Reynolds, a forceful voice for the view that ESG (environmental, social and governance) investing affects performance for the better. Barron’s sat down with Reynolds during the Climate Week summit at the U.N. General Assembly to talk about why climate risk matters, why financial advisors are still leery of ESG and how she’d advise a young person who wants to get into investment management....
description: The CEO of the U.N.-backed Principles for Responsible Investment talks with Barron’s Advisor about why climate risk matters, why financial advisors are still leery of ESG and how she’d advise a young person who wants to get into investment management.
